instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO: What is PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO? PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing/charging chip. This can be shorted to ground by the capacitor on its line, and when this happens, the chip can stop functioning which causes the charger to not turn on..
definitions.PP1V1_UPC_XB_LDO_BMC: What is PP1V1_UPC_XB_LDO_BMC? PP1V1_UPC_XB_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing/charging chip. This can be shorted to ground by the capacitor on its line, and when this happens, the chip can stop functioning which causes the charger to not turn on. This can also be missing if the CD3215 chip itself is bad..
definitions.PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOD: What is PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOD? PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing chip. When this is missing, either a capacitor on the line has shorted, PP3V3_G3H is missing, or the CD3215 is bad..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.CHGR_BMON: What is CHGR_BMON? CHGR_BMON goes between the ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 that charges the battery & creates PPBUS_G3H and the SMC(system management controller) or T2 chip(on machines where the SMC is integrated into the T2 chip) and provides current sensing information on battery charging to the SMC. If diagnostics reveal an off reading or failure with the charger current sense, this is a good place to start troubleshooting..
definitions.PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H: What is PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H? This is the input from the USB-C charger or the battery that is the input voltage for the chip responsible for creating PP3V3_G3H. It can be missing when capacitors on this line are shorted to ground, or when the diode in front of it leading to the chip that creates PP3V3_G3H is blown. .
definitions.CHGR_AMON: What is CHGR_AMON? CHGR_AMON provides DC current sense information to the SMC(System management controller) or T2 chip(on machines where the SMC is integrated into the T2 chip). It comes from the battery charging chip that controls the laptop charger, battery charging, and creation of PPBUS_G3H(ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 chip depending on the logic board part number and model). This is used for sensors. If a DC current sense sensor is reading off in diagnostics, this is a place to start looking. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.3V3_G3H: What is 3V3_G3H? This is one of the first power rails that must turn on for Macbooks that use USB-C for charging. This power rail powers the CD3215 chip that controls the USB-C charger, speaks to the USB-C charger, and requests 20 volts up from the default 5 volts that the USB-C charger puts out when initially connected to an unknown device. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't turn on. Liquid damaged.
threads.message:
This mac suffered oxidation in the <CHIP>U9300</CHIP>, UB300 and <TRANSISTOR>Q9401</TRANSISTOR> region, where the <CHIP>U9300</CHIP> was shorted, I took it out and tested it, but it doesn't show PPBUS. 

Voltage: PPbus 0V; <SIGNAL>PP20V_USBC_XB_VBUS_F</SIGNAL> 0V; <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> 5.116V shows oscillation; <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.4V; LDO rails showed ideal values in diode mode; <SIGNAL>PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOD</SIGNAL> 1.8V; <SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO</SIGNAL> 3.37V; <SIGNAL>PP1V1_UPC_XB_LDO_BMC</SIGNAL> 0v, oscillating ;

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't turn on. Liquid damaged.
threads.message:
Isn't strange to get PPDCIN without VBUS?

All USB-C ports have the same behaviour?
<TRANSISTOR>Q9401</TRANSISTOR> was shorted?
What is the actual resistance to ground at L9400?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't turn on. Liquid damaged.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>P2V7NAND_SW</SIGNAL> 0,391V
<SIGNAL>PPVIN_2V7NAND_LB</SIGNAL> 0,448V
L9400 0,6 Ohm
FB200,F3001,FB201 and F3000 5v, sorry, now the voltages are showing up.
The machine is without the <CHIP>U9300</CHIP>, does this influence the PPbus?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't turn on. Liquid damaged.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't turn on. Liquid damaged.
threads.message:
L9400 0.6 Ohm this value is the resistance of the component. The  value of <SIGNAL>P2V7NAND_R</SIGNAL> is 0.395V diode-scale. 
I want to know if there is voltage at <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> when the <CHIP>U9300</CHIP> is off the board ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't turn on. Liquid damaged.
threads.message:
<CHIP>U9300</CHIP> is dedicated for SSD power rails.
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> should appear without it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't turn on. Liquid damaged.
threads.message: What is causing this lack of voltage on the PPBUS?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't turn on. Liquid damaged.
threads.message:
Post basic voltages for <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>; listed many times on the forum.
Probably SMC doesn't communicate with <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>, nor with <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chips.
LDO voltages for <CHIP>U7800</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't turn on. Liquid damaged.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't turn on. Liquid damaged.
threads.message:
You forgot to post voltage for the last lines.
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> goes high?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't turn on. Liquid damaged.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't turn on. Liquid damaged.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_PMICLDO</SIGNAL> 0V no pulse.
<SIGNAL>PP5V_PMICLDO</SIGNAL> 0V no pulse.
<SIGNAL>PP5V_PMICLDO_R</SIGNAL> 0V no pulse.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't turn on. Liquid damaged.
threads.message:
There is a problem with <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>.
What about <SIGNAL>BUF_SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>?

<SIGNAL>3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> fluctuates too?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't turn on. Liquid damaged.
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 76650, member: 682"]

[/QUOTE]
<SIGNAL>BUF_SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> mesmo que <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>


[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 76650, member: 682"]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't turn on. Liquid damaged.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't turn on. Liquid damaged.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't turn on. Liquid damaged.
threads.message:
What about the other two USB-C ports?
You must get the same behaviour on ALL USB-C ports.
If not, there is still a problem on USB-C areas.
